meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Okay, okay, I know what you're thinking - why should I care about another mediocre LEGO game review? Well, let me tell you, dear reader, this one's different. I mean, who doesn't love a good trash can of a game? It's like a trainwreck that you can't look away from.

So, The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame (try saying that three times fast) has received a whopping 20% approval rating on the Critics' Circle (see what I did there?). COGconnected had this to say: "A frustrating cash grab." Ouch. That's like getting dumped by your favorite snack food - it hurts.

Eurogamer Italy agreed, calling it a reskin of LEGO Worlds with broken co-op. Yikes. Imagine playing through an entire game with a friend who keeps disappearing on you because the game won't even let them join in. Not exactly the most fun experience.

Metro GameCentral took it a step further, saying: "A cheap and nasty film tie-in that reaches a new low for Lego games." Wow, that's some strong language right there. I mean, I've had my fair share of disappointing gaming experiences, but this one takes the cake.

On the other hand, 3DJuegos thought the game was... well, not terrible? They praised the sandbox gameplay mechanics and how they refreshed the LEGO formula. I guess if you're a die-hard LEGO fan, you might find some redeeming qualities here.

But let's get to the real question - is this game worth your time? Well, Cubed3 said: "Everything is just meh." And honestly, that sums it up perfectly. It's like playing a game that's just... there. Not bad, not great, just... existent.

So, if you're looking for a fun LEGO experience, might I suggest skipping this one and going straight to DC Super-Villains or the Harry Potter re-release? Trust me, your time will be much better spent on those.

Or, if you're feeling adventurous and want to try something new (read: boring), go ahead and give The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame a shot. Just don't say I didn't warn you.
